summary: "Catch Me If You Can" is a 2002 American crime comedy-drama directed by Steven Spielberg and starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Tom Hanks. The film is based on the life of Frank Abagnale Jr., who allegedly scammed millions before turning 19 by pretending to be a pilot, doctor, and lawyer. The story's truth is disputed, but the movie was a big hit, making $352 million worldwide. It received two Academy Award nominations.
title: Catch Me If You Can
